channel.title: The ESPN F1 Podcast
channel.description: Want to know what's really going on behind the scenes of Formula One? ESPN's dedicated F1 journalists, Laurence Edmondson and Nate Saunders, join Alexis Nunes to discuss the biggest stories in the sport, offering insight and anecdotes from the heart of racing's top category as they follow it around the globe.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Want to know what's really going on behind the scenes of Formula One? ESPN's dedicated F1 journalists, Laurence Edmondson and Nate Saunders, join Alexis Nunes to discuss the biggest stories in the sport, offering insight and anecdotes from the heart of racing's top category as they follow it around the globe.
channel.itunes:author: ESPN, Alexis Nunes, Laurence Edmondson, Nate Saunders
channel.itunes:summary: Want to know what's really going on behind the scenes of Formula One? ESPN's dedicated F1 journalists, Laurence Edmondson and Nate Saunders, join Alexis Nunes to discuss the biggest stories in the sport, offering insight and anecdotes from the heart of racing's top category as they follow it around the globe.
channel.content:encoded: Want to know what's really going on behind the scenes of Formula One? ESPN's dedicated F1 journalists, Laurence Edmondson and Nate Saunders, join Alexis Nunes to discuss the biggest stories in the sport, offering insight and anecdotes from the heart of racing's top category as they follow it around the globe.

item.title: A season review: The best and worst of 2020
item.description: The team rank their best and worst moments of the 2020 Formula 1 season, as well as their most surprising moments from the year.

item.title: James Allison on DAS, the mighty W11 and Mercedes’ dominance
item.description: Mercedes technical director James Allison chats to Laurence Edmondson about the team’s dominant year, how F1 could become more competitive and the future of the sport in an ever-changing world.
item.itunes:title: James Allison on DAS, the mighty W11 and Mercedes’ dominance

item.title: Nicolas Hamilton on his brother Lewis and his own racing career
item.description: Sharing stories from before F1, Nicolas Hamilton joins Alexis Nunes to take a look back on his life growing up with Lewis, how he started in motorsport and the challenges he has overcome in his life and racing career. item.title: Why Hamilton matching Schumacher’s record is so remarkable

item.title: Can anyone stop Lewis Hamilton’s British Grand Prix domination?
item.description: After a weekend off, Formula 1 returns with a bang as the teams head to the UK for the first of a Silverstone doubleheader. ESPN F1’s Nate Saunders and Alexis Nunes wonder if anyone can stop Lewis Hamilton from winning a sixth British Grand Prix in seven years, and react to the news of canceled races all across the Americas. Meanwhile, Laurence Edmondson joins from Silverstone to share an almost poetic description of the Covid test that he, the rest of the media and the race crews are all undertaking to keep everyone safe and Alexis explains why it’s so important that Lewis Hamilton continues to champion the fight against racism after F1’s own disappointing showing so far.
item.itunes:title: Can anyone stop Lewis Hamilton’s British Grand Prix domination?
item.itunes:author: ESPN, Alexis Nunes, Laurence Edmondson, Nate Saunders
item.itunes:subtitle: ESPN F1’s Nate Saunders and Alexis Nunes return to get you up to speed before Formula 1 heads to Silverstone for the British Grand Prix.
item.itunes:summary: After a weekend off, Formula 1 returns with a bang as the teams head to the UK for the first of a Silverstone doubleheader. ESPN F1’s Nate Saunders and Alexis Nunes wonder if anyone can stop Lewis Hamilton from winning a sixth British Grand Prix in seven years, and react to the news of canceled races all across the Americas. Meanwhile, Laurence Edmondson joins from Silverstone to share an almost poetic description of the Covid test that he, the rest of the media and the race crews are all undertaking to keep everyone safe and Alexis explains why it’s so important that Lewis Hamilton continues to champion the fight against racism after F1’s own disappointing showing so far.
item.content:encoded:
After a weekend off, Formula 1 returns with a bang as the teams head to the UK for the first of a Silverstone doubleheader.

ESPN F1’s Nate Saunders and Alexis Nunes wonder if anyone can stop Lewis Hamilton from winning a sixth British Grand Prix in seven years, and react to the news of canceled races all across the Americas.

Meanwhile, Laurence Edmondson joins from Silverstone to share an almost poetic description of the Covid test that he, the rest of the media and the race crews are all undertaking to keep everyone safe and Alexis explains why it’s so important that Lewis Hamilton continues to champion the fight against racism after F1’s own disappointing showing so far.

item.title: How Verstappen went from zero to hero at the Hungarian GP
item.description: Nate Saunders and Laurence Edmondson take a look at another chaotic F1 race, which saw Max Verstappen finish second despite managing to crash before the race and Lewis Hamilton move closer to Michael Schumacher's victory record.
